Thank you for taking the time to apply. After reviewing your application, we have decided not to move forward with it at this time. While you provided some good responses, there were several areas that held your application back. A major concern was the lack of spelling, punctuation, and grammar throughout your answers. Strong SPaG is essential for a Supervising role, as clear and professional communication is necessary when working with both players and staff. Without this, it may come across as unprofessional. Some of your responses also lacked detail and did not show the level of dedication we look for in applicants. In future applications, please expand on your answers to better demonstrate your motivation and commitment. Additionally, your responses showed some misunderstanding of how our game operates. To clarify: our game is a Free Drive, not a Trained Drive. Drivers are free to choose their own routes in public servers, and routes are only assigned during shifts. We do not ‚Äúwarn‚Äù or ‚Äúwrite up‚Äù players for not being on time while operating their route. It‚Äôs important for applicants to have a clear understanding of these systems before applying. We encourage you to work on improving your SPaG, expand your answers with more detail, and gain a stronger understanding of how the game functions. Doing so will give you a much stronger chance of success in the future. Thank you again for your application, and we wish you the best going forward. Failed Stage 1.
